question: Who had a douce, quiet body?
answer1: an old man

question: Who was lightsome and flighty?
answer1: the old woman

question: Why was her husband afraid that she was a witch?
answer1: She had a curious habit of disappearing in the gloaming and staying out all night.

question: How did the wife look when she returned in the morning?
answer1: She looked quite white and tired, as if she had been travelling far, or working hard.

question: What did the husband do to find out where his wife went?
answer1: watched her carefully

question: How did the neighbors feel about the wife possibly being a witch?
answer1: scared

question: Why did the husband fail to find out where she went?
answer1: She always slipped out of the door when he was not looking, and before he could reach it to follow her, she had vanished utterly.

question: What did the husband do when he could not stand the uncertainty any longer?
answer1: asked her to tell him straight out whether she were a Witch or no

question: How did the husband feel while he asked his wife if she was a witch?
answer1: scared

question: What did the wife do after the husband asked if she was a witch?
answer1: answered that she was

question: What would the wife do if the husband promised not to let anyone know?
answer1: The next time that she went on one of her midnight expeditions she would tell him all about it.

question: Why did the husband make the promise to his wife?
answer1: It seemed to him just as well that he should know all about his wife's cantrips.

question: What happened on the first night of the new moon?
answer1: His wife vanished. Nor did she return till daybreak next morning.

question: Why didn't the husband have to wait long before he heard of his wife's stories?
answer1: The very next week the moon was new.

question: What did his wife and her four companions do on their trip?
answer1: met at the old Kirk on the moor and had mounted branches of the green bay tree and stalks of hemlock

question: What did his wife and her four companions hunt?
answer1: the foxes, and the weasels, and the owls

question: Who had a tiny set of bagpipes under his arm and piped such wonderful music?
answer1: a wee, wee man

question: Why were the Witches tired?
answer1: All the Witches danced until they were so weary.

question: What did the wife do at the next new moon?
answer1: go off again for the night

question: What did the husband want his wife to do instead of dancing all night?
answer1: stay at home

question: What did the wife and her friends use for boats?
answer1: cockle-shells

question: Where did the wife and her friends go to after getting on the boat?
answer1: Norway

question: What did the wife and her friends do after they took the cockle-shells for boats?
answer1: sailed away over the stormy sea till they reached Norway

question: Where did the wife and her friends go to after riding invisible horses?
answer1: the land of the Lapps

question: Why did the wife and her friends go to the land of the Lapps?
answer1: There was a festival.
answer2: They wanted to go to the festival.

question: How did the wife and her friends feel with the knowledge they acquired?
answer1: delighted

question: Why did the husband show a little more interest in her doings after her next adventure?
answer1: They drank rare wine.

question: How did the husband feel after his wife told him about her next adventure?
answer1: excited

question: What did the husband want to learn from his wife?
answer1: the magic words to take him to the Bishop's Palace

question: How did the witches land at the Bishop's Palace of Carlisle?
answer1: pronounced the magic words which they had learned from the Elves of Lappland

question: Why didn't the wife allow her husband to know the magic words?
answer1: It would turn the whole world upside down.

question: Why would the whole world turn upside down if everyone knew the magic words?
answer1: Everybody would be leaving their own lawful work, and flying about the world after other folk's business and other folk's dainties.

question: What did the husband do after his wife did not want to tell him the magic words?
answer1: tried to persuade her with all the soft words he could think of

question: What happened after his wife did not allow him to know her secret?
answer1: He followed his wife and her friends.
answer2: He repeated the magic words they said.

question: What happened after the husband repeated the magic words?
answer1: Up the chimney he went, and flew through the air after his wife and her companions, as if he had been a Warlock born.

question: Why did the husband follow his wife every night?
answer1: He hoped his and her friends would meet there.

question: Why didn't the witches notice that the husband was following them?
answer1: Witches are not in the habit of looking over their shoulders

question: Where did the witches and the husband fly to?
answer1: the Bishop's Palace

question: How will the witches feel after they find that the husband was among them?
answer1: not too well pleased

question: Why didn't the witches drink a lot of wine?
answer1: They knew that if they wanted to get home before cock-crow it behoved them to keep their heads clear.

question: Why wasn't the husband so wise?
answer1: He sipped, and he sipped, until at last he became quite drowsy, and lay down on the floor and fell fast asleep.

question: How did the wife teach her husband a lesson?
answer1: She departed without waking him.

question: Why did the wife want to teach her husband a lesson?
answer1: She did not want him to be so curious in the future.

question: What will happen after the wife leaves her husband in the Bishop's Palace?
answer1: The servants dragged him up to the light and shook him, and cuffed him, and asked him how he came to be there.

question: How will the husband feel after he is left alone in the Bishoop's Palace?
answer1: confused

question: How will the servants feel after they find the husband in the cellar?
answer1: astonished

question: Why did the servants believe that he was a warlock?
answer1: The husband told them that he travelled on the midnight wind.
answer2: The husband told them how he came here.

question: How did the servants feel after they believed he was a warlock?
answer1: terrified

question: Why did the servants drag the husband before the Bishop?
answer1: Bishops in those days had a holy horror of Warlocks and Witches

question: How did the husband feel after the sentence was pronounced?
answer1: scared

question: What did the husband wish for after his sentence was pronounced?
answer1: wished with all his heart that he had stayed quietly at home in bed, and never hankered after the Bishop's wine

question: Why did the husband forget that his wife was a witch?
answer1: The poor old man thought that his last hour had come.

question: What happened after the husband was taken into the courtyard?
answer1: His wife came to save him.

question: Why was the Grey Bird's croak the sweetest music that he had ever heard?
answer1: For to him it was the croak of no earthly bird, but the voice of his wife whispering words of magic to him.

question: How did the husband feel after he realized his wife came to save him?
answer1: happy

question: Who was a little red pirinie?
answer1: the Grey Bird

question: How did the onlookers feel after the husband flew away?
answer1: surprised

question: Why did his wife whisper words of magic to him?
answer1: He needed to say these words to escape.

question: Where did the husband fly to?
answer1: the Kingdom of Fife

question: Why did the husband leave his wife alone and never tried to find out her secrets again?
answer1: He got himself in trouble.
